translate("If you select notes that contain Any text, then searching for text in the note is not done.")

translate("Searching for text can be done by selecting notes that contain specific words or text.") translate("When you select this option, you will see that an entry becomes visible.") translate("Search text should be entered there.") translate("Then the Save button should be pressed.") translate("This is to save that search text.") translate(" Or just pressing Enter while the cursor is in that entry will do also.")

translate("When you search for, for example, 'house', then notes that contain the word 'house' will be selected.") translate("Notes that contain the word 'houses' (in plural) would not be selected.") translate("To select this plural form, you can use wildcards.") translate("Instead of entering 'house, enter 'house*'.") translate("Notice the asterisk.") translate("This will select notes that contains the word 'house' or 'houses.")

translate("You can also enter two or more words to search for.") translate("The search routine will then do its best to select these notes that contain some or all of these words.") translate("Notes that contain all words are given first, and notes that contains only one or a few of the words will be given later.")

translate("If you select notes that refer to the current verse, and then also search for some text, then only the notes that refer to the current verse would be searched.") translate("It is important to be aware of this.") translate("At times one may search for words or phrases, and get zero results, yet he is sure that there should be some results.") translate("This would happen because the user does not search the whole Bible, but only the current verse.") translate("The same applies to other selection mechanisms.") translate("Therefore, when searching notes for text, you may want to set all other selection mechanisms to Any.")


translate("There is more that can be said about searching notes.") translate("The wildcard operator already has been mentioned.") translate("Here is a list of possible operators:")

translate("By default, when no operator specified, the word is optional, but the result that contain it will be rated higher.")
+translate("A leading plus sign indicates that this word must be present in every result returned.")
-translate("A leading minus sign indicates that this word must not be present in any result returned.")
~ translate("A leading tilde acts as a negation operator, causing the word's contribution to the result relevance to be negative.") translate("It's useful for marking noise words.") translate("A result that contains such a word will be rated lower than others, but will not be excluded altogether, as it would be with the minus operator.")
* translate("An asterisk is the wildcard operator.") translate("Unlike the other operators, it is appended to the word, or fragment, not prepended.") translate("This means that if there is a note with the word 'house', and you search for '*ouse', this note will not be selected.") translate("Yes, this is unusual, but this is how the database search works.") translate("To minimize the pain of this, measures have been taken that if you type any part of the word, the expected result will still be found.")
"translate("Double quotes at the beginning and end of a phrase, gives only the notes that contain the complete phrase, as it was typed.")
